sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RUSTIC in architecture, implies a manner of budding in imitation of nature, rather than according to the rules of art. See Architecture.

Rusτιc Gods, dii rufilιci, in antiquity, were the gods of the country, or thoſe who preſided over agriculture, &c. Varro invokes the 12 dît confiâtes, as the principal among the ruſtic gods ; viz. Jupiter, Tellus, the Sun, Moon, Ceres, Bacchus, Rubigus, Flora, Minerva, Venus, Lympha, and Good Luck. Beſides theſe 12 aich-ruſtic gods, there were an infinity of leſſer ones ; as Pales, Vertumnus, Tutelina 5 Fulgor, Stercu-lius, Mellona, Jugatinus, Collinus, Vallonia, Terminus, Sylvanus, and Priapus. Struvius adds the Satyrs, Fauns, Sileni, Nymphs, and even Tritons ; and gives the empire over all the ruſtic gods to the god Pan.
R υsτ!C Order, that decorated with ruſtic quoins, ruſtic work, &e.
RUsτ∣c Work, is where the ſtones in the face, &c. of a building, inſtead of being ſmooth, are hatched, or picked with the point of a hammer.
